result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose A Perez Jr

defendant.name: Perez, Jose A, Jr
defendant.address: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Tapia advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

10:53 AM Defendant Jose A Perez in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Dawn Maldonado appeared as interpreter and previously sworn in.

The State moves to dismiss and read into cases 21CF730 & 21CF943.
The Court dismisses and reads into cases 21CF730 & 21CF943.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:11 AM Defendant Jose A Perez in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dawn Maldonado appeared by Zoom as interpreter and sworn in.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.
SPANISH INTERPRETER NEEDED AT THE NEXT HEARING.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Filed by Atty. Tapia
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:47 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.  Defendant Jose A Perez in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter and is sworn in.  Court notes the matter is before the Court on Defense Motion to Modify Bail.  Court reviews the bail that is currently set on all of the defendant's matters.  Atty. Tapia presents arguments; he is asking that cash bail be lowered to a total of $1500.00 split between all of the cases.  State objects and presents arguments.  Court places its findings on the record; for reasons placed on the record the Court will deny the motion to modify bail.  Bail to remain as previously set.  Court notes the matter is set for preliminary hearing before the Court Commissioner and inquires if the matter should remain on the calendar for that date.  Atty. Tapia is asking the preliminary hearing remain on the calendar but that the matters also be set for plea and sentencing also.  Court will keep the 06/08/2022 Preliminary Hearing on the calendar but also set the matters for plea and sentencing.  Spanish Interpreter needed to the plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on June 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Filed by Atty. Tapia.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

10:40 AM Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court.   Defendant Jose A Perez did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dawn Maldonado appeared as interpreter and excused due to non appearance.  State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail.  Court issues a capias and revokes/forfeits bail.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

02:11 PM Defendant Jose A Perez in court, in custody, with attorney Priya Barnes.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared by Zoom as interpreter.  Attorney Barnes appears as friend of the court.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office, as he was not on the list.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  INTERPRETER NEEDED AT THE NEXT HEARING.  Hearing scheduled for February 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
